items.title: Viral apple cider vinegar weight loss study retracted for flawed science
bullets: • BMJ Group has retracted research suggesting that small daily quantities of apple cider vinegar might help people who are overweight or obese to lose weight
• The small clinical trial was published in the open access journal BMJ Nutrition, Prevention & Health in March 2024 and its findings press released

items.title: White House says layoffs 'imminent' with no end to shutdown in sight
bullets: • White House says mass layoffs 'imminent' with no end to shutdown in sight
• The shutdown began on Wednesday after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree a new spending plan
• The Senate has since adjourned, raising fears that the shutdown could drag on and cost the US economy billions

items.title: A new China tech visa has caught India's attention - now locals aren't happy
bullets: • A new China visa targeting foreign professionals in science and technology went into effect on Wednesday
• Indian media referred to it as "China's H-1B" - a reference to the US visa for skilled workers
• It is still unclear whether the visa will actually allow foreigners to work in China or whether it just allows them easier access

items.title: That annoying SMS phish you just got may have come from a box like this
bullets: • Scammers have been abusing unsecured cellular routers used in industrial settings to blast SMS-based phishing messages in campaigns that have been ongoing since 2023, researchers say
• The routers are rugged Internet of Things devices that use cellular networks to connect traffic lights, electric power meters, and other sorts of remote industrial devices to central hubs

items.title: Megafauna was the meat of choice for South American hunters
bullets: • Archaeologists examined animal bones at sites dating to the waning years of the last Ice Age
• They found evidence that people butchered giant sloths, giant armadillos, and elephant-like creatures were on the menu for hunters in South America

items.title: OpenAI mocks Musk’s math in suit over iPhone/ChatGPT integration
bullets: • Apple and OpenAI are fighting to block OpenAI from using ChatGPT to compete with Apple's ChatGPS
• The company says it will only have access to "a small fraction of the potential market" of potential users
• OpenAI and Apple argue that this gives them access to a portion of the market for new features

items.title: Hyundai gives the Ioniq 5 a huge price cut for model-year 2026
bullets: • Hyundai is giving the Ioniq 5 a huge price cut
• The cheapest version of the electric vehicle is still the SE RWD
• The price cuts for other versions are even greater
• But the cuts have only been applied to cars built in the US

items.title: NASA employees on Artemis missions with SpaceX, Blue Origin to work through shutdown
bullets: • NASA is requiring employees involved in Artemis missions with contractors SpaceX and Blue Origin to stay on the job during the government shutdown
• NASA employees are expected to receive pay for their work after a reopening
• NASA will continue to support "planned operations" of the International Space Station

items.title: Four ways this US government shutdown could end
bullets: • US Senate was unable to pass a spending bill that would have kept the US government funded
• At some point, this shutdown – like all the ones before it - will end at some point
• Here are four scenarios for how that might play out

items.title: Pope Leo XIV says 'inhuman treatment of immigrants' in the U.S. isn't 'pro-life'
bullets: • Pope Leo XIV says 'inhuman treatment of immigrants' in the U.S
• isn't 'pro-life' Pope says Catholic politicians must be judged on full range of policy positions
• White House spokesman: "I would reject there is inhumane treatment of illegal immigrants under this administration"

items.title: Violence breaks out in Morocco as anti-government protests rage for fourth day
bullets: • Anti-government demonstrations gripped Morocco for the fourth night in a row as young people filled the streets of cities and destruction and violence broke out in several places
• The “Gen Z” demonstrations mirror similar unrest sweeping countries such as Nepal and Madagascar
• Dozens of peaceful protesters were arrested over the weekend

items.title: A new documentary about a dastardly worm and a heroic effort by Jimmy Carter
bullets: • The President and the Dragon premieres on Amazon Prime Video Oct
• Documentary explores the effects of Guinea worm disease
• Former President Jimmy Carter made it his life's mission to eliminate the disease
• Guinea worm disease is spread through contaminated water and undercooked fish

items.title: Jane Fonda calls for 'creative nonviolent noncooperation' to defend free speech
bullets: • Hundreds of A-list celebrities have signed on to support the Committee for the First Amendment
• Jane Fonda calls for 'creative nonviolent noncooperation' to defend free speech
• She's leading the organization, following in the footsteps of her father, Henry Fonda

items.title: Leon Cooperman says we've reached the stage of the bull market that Warren Buffett warned about
bullets: • Longtime investor Leon Cooperman believes we are in the late innings of a bull market where bubbles can form and risks rise
• Warren Buffett warned in 1999 that bull markets often end when valuations are stretched and irrational exuberance is rampant
• The S&P 500 has surged almost 40% since April lows, returning to all-time highs

items.title: Activists say Israel's navy has begun intercepting a Gaza-bound aid flotilla
bullets: • Activists say Israel's navy has begun intercepting a Gaza-bound aid flotilla
• The Global Sumud Flotilla consists of nearly 50 boats and 500 activists
• It has remained undeterred in its mission to break the Israeli blockade of the coastal strip

items.title: A NPR visual series takes a look at the rhythm of cumbia
bullets: • NPR visual series takes a look at the rhythm of cumbia
• Cumbia's simple, yet contagious, rhythm absorbed local styles, morphed, and reinvented itself
• It has become one of the most listened-to genres in the Americas

items.title: Sen. Cortez Masto explains why she broke ranks with democrats on shutdown vote
bullets: • Sen
• Cortez Masto explains why she broke ranks with democrats on shutdown vote
• Three Senate Democrats broke with their party and voted with Republicans to fund the government and avert a shut down
• One of the few exceptions is Nevada Senator Catherine Cortez-Masto of Nevada

items.title: Jane Goodall, legendary primatologist, has died at age 91
bullets: • Jane Goodall, a scientist whose studies of wild chimpanzees made her a household name, has died at the age of 91
• Her groundbreaking discoveries showed just how much chimps are like humans
• "They kiss, embrace, hold hands, pat one another on the back," Goodall said

items.title: Trump freezes $18 billion in funding for NYC, home to key Democratic leaders
bullets: • $18 billion in funding for New York City's Second Avenue subway project is put on hold
• The money will be used to build a tunnel under the Hudson River
• The project is a key priority for Democrats in the U.S
• Senate and House of Representatives

items.title: When will the government reopen? Here's how long past shutdowns lasted
bullets: • The first shutdown in over five years began just after midnight on Wednesday
• The government's most recent shutdown was the longest in history, lasting at 35 days
• A new poll shows that more Americans hold Republicans responsible for the shutdown
• It's not clear how long the shutdown could last, but multiweek shutdowns are more common in recent decades

items.title: What will Congress do after the shutdown? We asked a Republican and a Democrat
bullets: • Most of the federal government is shut down after Senate Republicans and Democrats failed to reach a funding agreement to keep it open
• Democrats wanted to extend Affordable Care Act subsidies used to make health insurance premiums more affordable
• Republicans said they wanted to discuss extending the credits after reaching an agreement to fund the government

items.title: What happens when the firewall between the White House and the DOJ comes down?
bullets: • President Trump is pressuring the Department of Justice to pursue his political enemies
• Legal scholar Barbara McQuade explains how this damages the rule of law
• This week, the Justice Department ordered federal prosecutors in at least seven states to draft plans to investigate George Soros' Open Society Foundations

items.title: The billion-year reign of fungi that predated plants and made Earth livable
bullets: • Fungi may have shaped Earth’s landscapes long before plants appeared
• They may have partnered with algae, recycling nutrients, breaking down rock, and creating primitive ecosystems
• The discovery could help explain the origin of life in the world's most complex ecosystems

items.title: CNBC's The China Connection newsletter: China's K-visa plans spark worries of a talent flood
bullets: • China's new visa program was rolled out in August aimed at attracting global talent
• Critics say it's unfair to push back on those educated in China at the expense of those educated abroad
• The new program was among the top searches on social media site Weibo for days

items.title: Webb spots first hints of atmosphere on a potentially habitable world
bullets: • Webb spots first hints of atmosphere on a potentially habitable world 40 light years away
• Early data suggests hints of an atmosphere, but much remains uncertain
• Researchers have already ruled out a hydrogen-rich primordial atmosphere, pointing to the possibility of a secondary atmosphere that could sustain oceans or ice

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
bullets: • A court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the former president to death in absentia
• The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels in DRC’s eastern provinces
• He was also ordered to pay about $50bn in damages to the state and victims

items.title: Scientists just solved Uranus’ coldest mystery
bullets: • For decades, Uranus baffled scientists because it seemed to have no internal heat
• New computer modeling shows the planet actually emits more energy than it receives from the Sun
• This subtle warmth suggests Uranus’ story is more complex than previously thought, offering fresh clues about its violent past

items.title: A plant compound might be the secret weapon against gum disease
bullets: • Morin-based powder, extracted from guava leaves, apple peel, and figs, can be slowly released with the help of polymers and serve as an alternative to antibiotics
• This could replace antibiotics, avoid side effects from existing treatments, and help vulnerable patients maintain oral health

items.title: Dame Jane Goodall remembered as a 'true hero for the planet'
bullets: • Dr Goodall died of natural causes at the age of 91
• She was "one of the true giants of our time", says the U.S
• government
• She is remembered as a "true hero for the planet" and a "genius of nature"

items.title: South Korea's Kospi hits record high as Samsung and SK Hynix soar on OpenAI partnership
bullets: • South Korea's Kospi index jumped more than 3% Thursday to hit an all-time high
• Shares in Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix, which announced a partnership with OpenAI, rose over 4% and 11%
• Consumer price index climbed 2.1% year on year in September, more than the 2% expected by economists in a Reuters poll

items.title: Israeli naval ships intercept Gaza-bound flotilla
bullets: • Israeli navy intercepts boats carrying aid to Gaza and detains activists aboard
• Global Sumud Flotilla activists include climate campaigner Greta Thunberg
• Israeli Foreign Ministry says vessels were "safely stopped" and are being transferred to an Israeli port

items.title: SK Hynix shares hit 25-year high, Samsung also surges as chipmakers partner with OpenAI
bullets: • Samsung and SK Hynix have partnered with artificial-intelligence major OpenAI
• The two companies plan to scale up production of advanced memory chips
• The partnership is part of the U.S
• firm's Stargate initiative
• OpenAI CEO Sam Altman met with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung in Seoul

items.title: Meet the Arc spacecraft: it aims to deliver cargo anywhere in the world in an hour
bullets: • A new spacecraft company, Inversion, revealed its new "on demand" delivery vehicle Wednesday evening
• The company said it is building the Arc spacecraft to provide a capability to the US military to deliver as much as 500 pounds of supplies almost anywhere in the world, almost instantaneously

items.title: Perky Maxwell House viral ad takes on housing crisis as ‘Maxwell Apartment’
bullets: • Coffee company rebranding themselves as ‘Maxwell Apartment Coffee’ The company is also offering a year’s supply of its coffee for “under $40” on Amazon
• Last year, the median age of first-time homebuyers in the US hit an all-time high of 38, according to statistics from the National Association of Realtors

items.title: White House plays racist deepfake videos of Chuck Schumer and Hakeem Jeffries on loop – as it happened.
bullets: • White House warns that government shutdown is imminent
• No end in sight for the government shutdown, says White House
• White House plays racist videos of President Obama and Hillary Clinton on the shutdown
• President Obama says the government is working on a compromise deal to avoid a shutdown

items.title: Trump signs order promising measures, including military, to defend Qatar
bullets: • The text of the order appears to be another measure by Trump to assure the Qataris following Israel’s surprise attack on the country targeting Hamas leaders
• The order cites the two countries’ “close cooperation” and “shared interest”, vowing to “guarantee the security and territorial integrity of the state of Qatar against external attack”

items.title: Trump FCC chair to reportedly testify to Senate panel after Kimmel suspension
bullets: • Brendan Carr agreed to testify after speaking to committee chair Ted Cruz, Reuters reported, citing a source familiar with the matter
• The date of the hearing has not been set but was expected after November, the report said
• ABC suspended Jimmy Kimmel’s talk show after Carr appeared to pressure network affiliates to stop airing the show

items.title: US citizen sues after twice being detained by immigration agents
bullets: • Leo Garcia Venegas, a construction worker and US citizen, says he was detained twice by immigration agents in just a few weeks
• The lawsuit demands an end to what the firm calls “unconstitutional and illegal immigration enforcement tactics” The Department of Homeland Security dismissed the suit as “race-baiting opportunism”

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: What to know about the missions just launched in NASA's cosmic carpool
bullets: • All Things From The Heart of the Sun is available on CNN.com's iReport.com.com with details of the latest developments in space travel.com
• The world's largest telescope in the world's history is now orbiting the sun, and scientists say it could be used to study the solar system

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
bullets: • President Andry Rajoelina has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts
• The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in three days of demonstrations
• Thousands of people have marched in the capital Antananarivo since demonstrations began last week

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
bullets: • The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in Namibia's north, on 22 September
• The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park was to blame
• It said 49 soldiers were being deployed to fight the fires and a further 500 on Sunday

items.title: West Africans deported from US to Ghana ‘dumped without documents in Togo’
bullets: • Eight to 10 west African nationals have been forcibly sent by Ghana to Togo, bypassing a formal border crossing, and then left on the street without passports
• Up to 28 people have arrived in the west African nation from the US so far in the deportation programme

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: Trump admin adds banner attacking ‘Radical Left Democrats’ to government websites
bullets: • The Trump administration has put up banners across federal websites blaming Democrats for the government shutdown

• One banner on the US Department of Agriculture’s site says, “The Radical Left Democrats shut down the government” The White House website similarly includes a timer showing how long the shutdown has lasted so far

items.title: Apple sidelines lighter Vision Pro to prioritize smart glasses
bullets: • Apple is speeding up work on smart glasses that would compete with similar offerings from Meta
• The company may not release its first pair of smart glasses until 2027, putting it well behind Meta
• Apple is also halting plans for a lighter Vision Pro headset, Bloomberg reports

items.title: Amazon says its AI will let NBA fans track brand-new stats
bullets: • Amazon is rolling out a new AI-powered platform called NBA Inside the Game
• New stats will track players' movement and their ability to make a shot
• Analytics will also be able to predict the difficulty of each shot made by a player

items.title: Instagram tests opening right onto Reels
bullets: • Instagram is making Reels and DMs the first two tabs of the app
• The change is part of an opt-in test in India
• Photos from Instagram accounts will still be included in the new tab
• The home tab will be similar to what you see on the iPad

items.title: Trump’s solution for high drug prices is a discount portal called TrumpRx
bullets: • President Donald Trump is launching a new website that will let Americans buy medications at lower prices
• The new website, called TrumpRx, is expected to launch in 2026 and will direct consumers to discounts on drugmakers’ online stores
• The website is part of a deal that grants a three-year reprieve from tariffs in exchange for investing in manufacturing
